title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA cancels Hingham/Hull ferry service for Feb. 13 due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will replace canceled ferry services, running from Nantasket Beach to Hull Ferry Terminal on Feb. 13.
Recent winter storm, which brought over a foot of snow, caused multiple ferry service cancellations in Boston.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Retired firefighter Daniel Kennedy, 60, died after being struck by a Lowell police cruiser near UMass Lowell campus.
Kennedy was walking on Wilder Street when hit; he was transported to Lahey Hospital and died days later.
Massachusetts State Police and Middlesex DA's Office are investigating the incident involving the marked police cruiser.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas might start 2026 with Triple-A Worcester due to health and roster position at first base.
Kristian Campbell could begin 2026 in Worcester, facing defensive challenges and competition for the DH role.
Pitchers Payton Tolle and Connelly Early may start in Triple-A due to competition in the Red Sox's rotation.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: State officials in New Hampshire knew about plans for a new ICE facility since January 12, documents reveal.
The planned ICE facility in Merrimack, New Hampshire, will have a capacity of 400 to 600 beds.
DHS documents estimate the facility's renovation and operation costs at $158 million and $146 million, respectively.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots left tackle Will Campbell faced criticism after allowing 14 pressures in a Super Bowl loss to the Seahawks.
Dante Scarnecchia, former Patriots coach, supports keeping Campbell at left tackle despite his struggles in the 2025 season.
Campbell will train with ex-Pro Bowler Terron Armstead to address technical issues during the offseason in Dallas.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel consoled Patriots players after their 29-13 Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks at Levi's Stadium.
In his first season as Patriots head coach, Vrabel led the team to a 14-win record and an AFC East title.
Vrabel expressed optimism about the future, emphasizing the team's strong foundation and potential for growth.

title: Patriots reportedly make changes to coaching staff, move Williams to ‘high-ranking’ role
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots promote Terrell Williams to a high-ranking role on Mike Vrabel's staff, vacating the defensive coordinator position.
Zak Kuhr, interim play-caller, emerges as favorite for Patriots' defensive coordinator role after leading a strong 2026 season.
Williams, now cancer-free, supports Kuhr's potential DC promotion after battling prostate cancer throughout the 2025 season.

title: Pittsfield man, 69, killed in hit-and-run crash that dragged him ‘lengthy distance,’ DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Colbert, 69, was killed in a hit-and-run in Pittsfield on Tuesday night, authorities report.
Colbert was hit by a dark-colored sedan and dragged a 'lengthy distance' before being found near 1350 Housatonic Street.
Pittsfield police are seeking the driver and ask for public assistance with any information or surveillance footage.

title: ‘This is only the beginning’: Ann Michael Maye shares encouraging message after Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Ann Michael Maye praised the Patriots for their season after losing Super Bowl LX to the Seahawks 29-13.
Drake Maye set a Super Bowl record with 235 passing yards in a quarter despite Patriots' loss.
Ann Michael Maye gained attention for her 'Bakemas' videos and has built her own following.

title: This dad is running Boston to give back to Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Nick Gallagher, 38, from Plymouth, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Boston Children's Hospital's Miles for Miracles team.
Gallagher's participation honors the care his 4-year-old son received from the hospital's neurology team since birth.
He aims to give back to Boston Children's Hospital, crediting them with playing a crucial role in his son's health.
